value.name: ZERO
value.desc: No authentication required and a valid certificate does not need to be presented.

value.name: ONE
value.desc: A valid certificate must be presented.

value.name: TWO
value.desc: A valid certificate from a trusted certificate authority must be presented.

value.name: THREE
value.desc: A valid certificate from a trusted certificate authority must be presented and the CN field of the certificate's Subject entry must match the host sending the certificate.

value.name: ONE
value.desc: Symmetric key length of at least 40 bits is to be used

value.name: TWO
value.desc: Symmetric key length of at least 56 bits is to be used

value.name: THREE
value.desc: Symmetric key length of at least 80 bits is to be used

value.name: FOUR
value.desc: Symmetric key length of at least 128 bits is to be used

attribute.name: Algorithm
attribute.desc: The method used to encrypt the user's password. See the implementation details below.

attribute.name: KeyName
attribute.desc: The name of the key to be used for decryption of the password. Left blank for plain, encoded text (Algorithm attribute value of "base64") and hash algorithms.

infra.name: SIF_Ack
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message.

element.name: SIF_OriginalSourceId
element.desc: The SIF_SourceId of the infrastructure message for which the SIF_Ack serves as a response.

element.name: SIF_OriginalMsgId
element.desc: The SIF_MsgId of the infrastructure message for which the SIF_Ack message serves as a response.

element.name: SIF_Status
element.desc: This element is used to signal a successful response.

element.name: SIF_Error
element.desc: This element is used to signal an unsuccessful response.

element.name: SIF_Vendor
element.desc: The name of the company of the product that this agent supports.

element.name: SIF_Product
element.desc: The name of the product that this agent supports.

element.name: SIF_Version
element.desc: The version of the product. This field is informative only.

object.name: SIF_CancelRequests
object.desc: This sub-message asks a receiver (ZIS or Push-Mode Agent) to cancel the specified SIF_Requests, pending or in process.

element.name: SIF_Element
element.desc: This is the element/attribute being queried. See below for syntax.

element.name: SIF_Operator
element.desc: The comparison operator for the condition.

element.name: SIF_Value
element.desc: SIF_Value is the data that is used to compare with the value of the element or attribute.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: The Boolean operator for joining conditions (SIF_Conditions elements) within this element. Note that None should be used if there is only one SIF_Conditions element.

object.name: SIF_Contexts
object.desc: Each SIF Context that applies to the message. If none is specified, the applicable context is Default.

element.name: SIF_Code
element.desc: See Error Codes.

element.name: SIF_Desc
element.desc: A simple, easy to understand, description of the error. The primary consumer of this message is the application user. Example: "Unable to open database."

element.name: SIF_ExtendedDesc
element.desc: An optional error description that is more complete and technical in nature. It is to be used as a diagnostic message in trouble-shooting procedures. Example: "The 'Students' table is opened in exclusive mode by user 'ADM1' (dbm.cpp, line 300)."

infra.name: SIF_Event
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message.

attribute.name: ObjectName
attribute.desc: This is the name of the object being added, changed or deleted.

attribute.name: Action
attribute.desc: This is the action associated with the object that is being conveyed by this SIF_Event.

object.name: SIF_GetAgentACL
object.desc: This element holds the sub-message being sent.

object.name: SIF_GetMessage
object.desc: This element holds the sub-message being sent.

object.name: SIF_GetZoneStatus
object.desc: This element holds the sub-message being sent.

element.name: SIF_MsgId
element.desc: SIF_MsgId is a globally unique message identifier from the Agent or ZIS that sends out the message.

element.name: SIF_Timestamp
element.desc: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

element.name: SIF_SourceId
element.desc: The SIF_SourceId is the ID of the originator of the message. Each source needs to have a zone unique case-sensitive identifier.

element.name: SIF_DestinationId
element.desc: This element represents the ID of the recipient of the message and may be present as follows:

element.name: SIF_Contexts
element.desc: Each SIF Context that applies to the message. If none is specified, the applicable context is Default. Repeatable for SIF_Events, not repeatable for SIF_Request or SIF_Response.

attribute.name: Source
attribute.desc: The SIF node that logged this entry.

attribute.name: LogLevel
attribute.desc: The level of the log entry herein described.

element.name: SIF_Category
element.desc: A SIF_LogEntry category. May be omitted for informational-type postings, where typically a textual description will suffice.

element.name: SIF_Code
element.desc: A SIF_LogEntry code with regard to SIF_Category above. May be omitted for informational-type postings, where typically a textual description will suffice. If a SIF_Code is included, SIF_Category must be included as well.

element.name: SIF_ApplicationCode
element.desc: An error code specific to the application posting the entry. Can be used by vendors to query log entries for errors specific to their applications. If a SIF_ApplicationCode is included, SIF_Category must be included as well; i.e., application-specific error codes should fall within one of the defined log entry categories.

element.name: SIF_Desc
element.desc: A textual description of the error.

element.name: SIF_ExtendedDesc
element.desc: Any extended error description.

attribute.name: ObjectName
attribute.desc: The name of the SIF object referenced (e.g. StudentPersonal).

element.name: SIF_LogObject
element.desc: Any SIF data objects to which this log entry may apply.

attribute.name: ObjectName
attribute.desc: The name of a SIF data object

element.name: SIF_EventObject
element.desc: Contains the actual object (partial or whole) that is being added, changed or deleted.

element.name: SIF_Element
element.desc: Indicates the element/attribute by which to sort.

object.name: SIF_Ping
object.desc: This element holds the sub-message being sent.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: Identifies the type being used (e.g. "HTTP", "HTTPS", "MSMQ", etc.)

attribute.name: Secure
attribute.desc: Indicates if the protocol provides a secure channel

element.name: SIF_URL
element.desc: A URL that identifies the SIF_SIFNode

element.name: SIF_Property
element.desc: A set of properties defined for this protocol

infra.name: SIF_Provide
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message.

attribute.name: SourceId
attribute.desc: The identifier of the SIF node that is providing objects. This is the agent or ZIS identifier that would appear in the SIF_SourceId field of any SIF_Header created by the SIF node.

attribute.name: SourceId
attribute.desc: The identifier of the SIF node that is providing objects. This is the agent or ZIS identifier that would appear in the SIF_SourceId field of any SIF_Header created by the SIF node.

element.name: SIF_ConditionGroup
element.desc: Either SIF_ConditionGroup or SIF_Example may optionally be specified to present conditions matching objects should satisfy.

element.name: SIF_Example
element.desc: An example SIF object that serves as a template for matching objects. There is an implied EQ operator for every element/attribute value present and an implied And group of all resulting conditions. Currently this is an experimental feature and limited to use with LearnerLocator; wider use may be considered in future major versions of this specification.

element.name: SIF_Element
element.desc: Individual elements/attributes being requested of matching object. See syntax below. If specified, only the elements/attributes requested are returned in the SIF_Response (with any parent elements/attributes); otherwise, all elements supported by the provider's object are returned.

infra.name: SIF_Register
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message.

element.name: SIF_Name
element.desc: This is the descriptive name of the agent that is registering (i.e. Ramsey Media Center).

element.name: SIF_Version
element.desc: Specifies which SIF Specification version(s) the agent supports. If the ZIS cannot communicate in this format, it should reject the request.

element.name: SIF_MaxBufferSize
element.desc: Specifies the maximum size of a packet to be returned by the ZIS. The ZIS may return packets smaller than, or equal to, the maximum value.

element.name: SIF_Mode
element.desc: Specifies the communication mode (Pull or Push) as chosen by the message sender.

element.name: SIF_NodeVendor
element.desc: The vendor of the SIF agent.

element.name: SIF_NodeVersion
element.desc: The agent version number. The format of this field is undefined, but it should match the format used in the agent's conformance statement, if the agent is SIF Certified.

element.name: SIF_Icon
element.desc: HTTP URL referencing an icon for graphical representation of the application/agent. Should range from 16x16 pixels to 128x128 pixels and be of an image MIME type commonly supported by Web browsers (e.g. PNG, JPEG, GIF). Agents may optionally follow the more restrictive guidelines at [FAVICON].

infra.name: SIF_Request
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message.

element.name: SIF_Version
element.desc: Specifies which SIF Specification version should be used when returning the response data; wildcards are allowed. The version specified by SIF_Message/@Version SHOULD be the preferred version to return if it exists in the list, either explicitly or implicitly via a wildcard. Otherwise the responding agent can return data in any version it chooses that matches/satisfies one of the versions in the list.

element.name: SIF_MaxBufferSize
element.desc: Specifies the maximum size of a response packet to be returned to the requester. The responder may return packets smaller than, or equal to, the maximum value. If the maximum size is too small to contain a single whole response object, the responder should reject the SIF_Request. To guarantee delivery of response packets, requesting agents must not specify a SIF_MaxBufferSize greater than its registered SIF_Register/SIF_MaxBufferSize.

element.name: SIF_Query
element.desc: Either SIF_Query or SIF_ExtendedQuery must be specified, which contain the criteria to be used to match response objects.

attribute.name: SourceId
attribute.desc: The identifier of the SIF node that is providing objects. This is the agent or ZIS identifier that would appear in the SIF_SourceId field of any SIF_Header created by the SIF node.

attribute.name: SourceId
attribute.desc: The identifier of the SIF node that is providing objects. This is the agent or ZIS identifier that would appear in the SIF_SourceId field of any SIF_Header created by the SIF node.

infra.name: SIF_Response
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message. The SIF_DestinationId needs to be the SIF_SourceId of the original SIF_Request message being processed.

element.name: SIF_RequestMsgId
element.desc: This is the message ID of the SIF_Request message being processed. It provides a unique match between a SIF_Response and a previous SIF_Request. Since the ID of each message from an agent is unique, the receiver of a SIF_Response message will be able to relate the SIF_Response to a SIF_Request that it sent out previously.

element.name: SIF_PacketNumber
element.desc: This element represents the index of the SIF_Response message in the sequence of packets that make up a complete response. Its value must be in the range of 1 through n, with n equal to the total number of packets that make up a response.

element.name: SIF_MorePackets
element.desc: This element provides an indication as to whether there are more packets besides this one to make up a complete response.

element.name: SIF_ObjectData
element.desc: The SIF_ObjectData element contains the data objects matching the supplied criteria in the SIF_Request message if the SIF_Request contained SIF_Query. If the SIF_Request contained SIF_ExtendedQuery, include SIF_ExtendedQueryResults. If the SIF_Error element is present, this element MUST be empty.

element.name: SIF_ExtendedQueryResults
element.desc: This element contains the elements requested by SIF_ExtendedQuery in SIF_Request. If the SIF_Error element is present, this element MUST be empty.

element.name: SIF_AuthenticationLevel
element.desc: The minimum level of authentication required by the message originator to be considered a secure channel upon message delivery to other agents.

element.name: SIF_EncryptionLevel
element.desc: The minimum level of encryption required by the message originator to be considered a secure channel upon message delivery to other agents.

attribute.name: Distinct
attribute.desc: Specifies whether query results should return all rows (false) or just distinct ones (true). Rows are distinct if at least one column differs between them.

attribute.name: RowCount
attribute.desc: The maximum number of rows to return. If All, return all rows, otherwise return the top rows up to the maximum row count indicated.

attribute.name: Type
attribute.desc: The type of node ("Agent" or "ZIS")

element.name: SIF_Name
element.desc: The descriptive name of the SIF node (i.e. Ramsey Food Services).

element.name: SIF_Icon
element.desc: HTTP URL referencing an icon for graphical representation of the application/agent. Should range from 16x16 pixels to 128x128 pixels and be of an image MIME type commonly supported by Web browsers (e.g. PNG, JPEG, GIF). Agents may optionally follow the more restrictive guidelines at [FAVICON].

element.name: SIF_NodeVendor
element.desc: The vendor of the SIF agent.

element.name: SIF_NodeVersion
element.desc: The agent version number. The format of this field is undefined, but it should match the format used in the agent's conformance statement, if the agent is SIF Certified.

element.name: SIF_SourceId
element.desc: The agent or ZIS identifier. This is the same value that the SIF node would place in any SIF_Header that it would create.

element.name: SIF_Mode
element.desc: Specifies the communication mode (Pull or Push) as chosen by the message sender.

element.name: SIF_AuthenticationLevel
element.desc: This is the level of authentication that the SIF node supports when it wants to communicate via a secure channel.

element.name: SIF_EncryptionLevel
element.desc: This is the level of encryption that the SIF node supports when it wants to communicate via a secure channel.

element.name: SIF_MaxBufferSize
element.desc: Specifies that the ZIS should never send packets larger than this value. Query responses from other providers are controlled by the SIF_MaxBufferSize attribute in the SIF_Request message.

element.name: SIF_Sleeping
element.desc: This element shows whether the SIF node is ready to process messages.

object.name: SIF_Sleep
object.desc: This element holds the sub-message being sent.

element.name: SIF_Desc
element.desc: An optional textual description/equivalent of SIF_Code.

element.name: SIF_Data
element.desc: Optional element to hold data related to a successful operation. This data is currently limited to a SIF_Message returned by the ZIS in response to a Pull-Mode Agent's SIF_GetMessage, SIF_AgentACL returned by the ZIS in response to SIF_Register and SIF_GetAgentACL, and SIF_ZoneStatus returned by the ZIS in response to SIF_GetZoneStatus.

infra.name: SIF_Subscribe
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message.

attribute.name: SourceId
attribute.desc: The identifier of the SIF node that is subscribing to the object events. This is the agent or ZIS identifier that would appear in the SIF_SourceId field of any SIF_Header created by the SIF node.

element.name: SIF_ObjectList
element.desc: The name of the object being subscribed to by this SIF_SIFNode

element.name: SIF_Version
element.desc: Lists a specific SIF Specification version.

infra.name: SIF_SystemControl
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message.

element.name: SIF_SystemControlData
element.desc: This element holds the sub-message being sent.

object.name: SIF_SystemControlData
object.desc: This element holds the sub-message being sent by the <SIF_SystemControl> message. This class is used internally by the ADK. To send a ping, sleep, or wakeup request to the Zone Integration Server, agents should call the sifPing, sleep, and wakeup methods of the Zone and Agent classes. SIF_GetMessage is automatically sent by the class framework for zones that are connected in Pull mode.

infra.name: SIF_Unprovide
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message.

infra.name: SIF_Unregister
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

infra.name: SIF_Unsubscribe
infra.desc: Contains one of the SIF message types.

element.name: SIF_Header
element.desc: Header information associated with this message.

element.name: SIF_Name
element.desc: The name of the company who wrote the ZIS.

element.name: SIF_Product
element.desc: The product name assigned by the vendor to identify this ZIS.

element.name: SIF_Version
element.desc: The version of the vendor's product--not necessarily the SIF version.

element.name: SIF_Version
element.desc: This is the version or versions of the SIF Specification that the SIF node uses. For agents, this information was communicated when the SIF node registered with the ZIS.

object.name: SIF_Wakeup
object.desc: This element holds the sub-message being sent.

attribute.name: ZoneId
attribute.desc: The identifier for this Zone. It is the same as the SIF_SourceId that the ZIS would place in any SIF_Header that it creates.

element.name: SIF_Name
element.desc: The descriptive name for the zone.

element.name: SIF_Icon
element.desc: HTTP URL referencing an icon for graphical representation of the ZIS/Zone. Should range from 16x16 pixels to 128x128 pixels and be of an image MIME type commonly supported by Web browsers (e.g. PNG, JPEG, GIF). Agents may optionally follow the more restrictive guidelines at [FAVICON].

element.name: SIF_AdministrationURL
element.desc: Should a ZIS vendor provide an administration interface for the zone via a URL, the ZIS can make the URL available in SIF_ZoneStatus. Agent administrators can use the URL to access zone administration features, should they have permission to do so.
